Sentencas: The H2O-CO2 electrochemical conversion process in solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cells is potentially an efficient way to reduce CO2 emissions and to store renewable power simultaneously.
Titulo: Electrochemical performance of H2O-CO2 coelectrolysis with a tubular solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cell

Sentencas: In this study, a tubular solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cell based on a general electrode support solid oxide fuel cell was fabricated and investigated.
Titulo: Electrochemical performance of H2O-CO2 coelectrolysis with a tubular solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cell

Sentencas: We fabricated tubular electrode support tubes through an extrusion process, and the essential SOC cell components, i.e., the electrolyte and the electrode, were then coated onto the surface of a ceramic support consecutively using a vacuum slurry and dip-coating method.
Titulo: Electrochemical performance of H2O-CO2 coelectrolysis with a tubular solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cell

Sentencas: The cell was operated while varying the operating temperature, cathode gas flow rate, and the supplied amount of H2O.
Titulo: Electrochemical performance of H2O-CO2 coelectrolysis with a tubular solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cell

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that the fabricated tubular SOC cell is a promising candidate for many practical applications, such as technology to mitigate climate change and power fluctuations associated with renewable energy.
Titulo: Electrochemical performance of H2O-CO2 coelectrolysis with a tubular solid oxide coelectrolysis (SOC) cell
